sentences: Aidake vanaema laua äärest voodisse puhkama.
Kus viga näed, tule ja aita!
context: The word 'aidake' is the plural imperative form of the Estonian verb 'aitama', meaning to help or assist. It's used when addressing multiple people and telling them to help someone or do something helpful. This form carries the sense of 'You (plural) help!' or 'Help! (to a group)'. The root word 'aita' appears in many compound words and expressions related to assistance.
